review:
Hyperdrive Massacre (2015)

Fun arcade style game but highly recommended to play with friends. Half of the game modes can only be played with a friend in your team. It's also just better with friends then the ai teaming up against you and performing insane trick shots. You also need a controller to play with, which is kinda a bummer if your mates don't have one. It does play extremely fun with a controller, but i'm sure a mouse and keyboard could also have worked. You play as a flying car in space and you shoot down the competition for score. You can drop homing mines, once one of those chase you its basically almost always over for you. Other game modes include soccer and pong. Fun game to play with friends, if you can find some with remotes. The game is worth it to kill off a few hours if you like arcade shooters.

8/10

review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. review:
Feeble.

I read the reviews.  It is a bit like asteroids.  It is not.  It is like Combat from the Atari 2600.  Yep a 50 year old game.  That was only 4k and it was better.  So you fly around a screen and the play field wraps around just like in Asteroids or Combat.  
Pros
It is like micro machines in space graphically. A very impressive ps1 game.  The sound track is good fun for about 5 minutes. 
cons
The game is fun for about 3 minutes.  
You get spawn killed right at the start.  Then the computer controlled car just shoots you to pieces.
The control is awful.  You seem to switch 180 degrees as the only way of controlling the ship/space taxi.
The computer controlled car has no such problem manoeuvring.  It might be fun as a 4 player game but who has 3 other friends who want to play this ps1 game?

I got it in a bundle of 10 other games.  It still feels like I have been cheated.

review:
Just because the game is "retro-themed" doesn't automatically make this a good game.

While it has interesting concepts involving multiplayer as an asteroids clone with better graphics, the overall experience falls short of what could be a great game. No mouse and keyboard support turns away a vast majority of users from the get-go.

The graphics aren't all that great and the AI is hacking every step of the way even on normal while you fumble around with the controls and struggle to get your floaty vehicle under control.

$10 is a lot to ask for a game that is all style and no substance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012473463', 'num_games_owned': 4077, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1591471459}
review:
[h1]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36214917/]Curator Group for more reviews[/url][/h1]

Hyperdrive Massacre is a local multiplayer arcade game that features a variety of game modes. The core gameplay involves driving your car and trying to shoot your enemies. It is all from a top-down perspective and isn't anything revolutionary, but is  fairly well executed. Some game modes put a twist on it by removing guns and adding a new goal, such as trying to knock a soccer ball into a goal. These are the most interesting modes, as the generic deathmatch modes are just standard for the genre. The game's biggest problem is the spawning, which forces you to respawn in the same spot after every death. Because the game arena wraps, instead of having borders, it is very easy to get caught in a weird cycle of deaths because you can't get away from one area without getting killed. It is an even bigger issue in the non-combat modes, where you always respawn near your goal, making it extremely frustrating to score because you need to go through your opponents 3 or 4 times without dying. Overall, a decent game with a few issues that bring it down quite a bit.

4/10

review:
The controls are terrible in the game and the AI makes for a very frustrating experience. It's probably cool as a party game, but you'll hardly be able to practice it otherwise, which makes it chaotic and unfun. While in-game the car you're driving constantly steer backwards from every bullet you fire and acceleration feels extremely weird with the way cars turn around using the joystick, especially when going backwards; you can never tell where you're going and sometimes you'll die randomly to a bullet that's somehow not on screen. Worst of all, on the game menus the d-pad is extremely delayed and browsing it with a joystick is a nightmare.

This kind of game would play a lot better if you could control your momentum rather than drift hopelessly dodging bullets and hoping you get a lucky hit, so that there's actual skill involved without spending 5-10 hours to practice. If you didn't bounce all over the place from firing projectiles you'd have more strategy than just holding the foward button and shield.

review:
Best party game ever.  It's multiplayer asteroids!!!  With a very polished overall game design.  It's literally perfect.  Everything from UI, controller support, design aesthetic, the works.  I had a blast playing it.  You can drive batmobiles and Back To The Future's DeLorean among other cars that are designed to look like the real thing (Corvette C3!!).  

I can't wait to try this out with friends.  There are a lot of modes like soccer which should be very interesting when you are playing with some buddies.  

I guess the only thing they could add is online multiplayer. 

SUPER impressed.  ONE BILLION STARS out of 10.  What a time to be alive.  I remember how fun it was to play asteroids back in the day... But multiplayer deathmatch asteroids?  I never would have even imagined this.  

Best with friends.  Co-op AI is really difficult but not impossible.
